class.name: DiscordLobbyMemberHandle
class.brief_description: A [DiscordLobbyMemberHandle] represents the state of a single user in a Lobby.
class.description: The SDK separates lobby membership into two concepts: - Has the user been added to the lobby by the game developer? If the [DiscordLobbyMemberHandle] exists for a user/lobby pair, then the user has been added to the lobby. - Does the user have an active game session that is connected to the lobby and will receive any lobby messages? It is possible for a game developer to add a user to a lobby while they are offline. Also users may temporarily disconnect and rejoin later. So the [code]Connected[/code] boolean tells you whether the user is actively connected to the lobby. Handle objects in the SDK hold a reference both to the underlying data, and to the SDK instance. Changes to the underlying data will generally be available on existing handles objects without having to re-create them. If the SDK instance is destroyed, but you still have a reference to a handle object, note that it will return the default value for all method calls (ie an empty string for methods that return a string).

method.name: can_link_lobby
method.description: Returns true if the user is allowed to link a channel to this lobby. Under the hood this checks if the LobbyMemberFlags::CanLinkLobby flag is set. This flag can only be set via the server API, add_lobby_member The use case for this is for games that want to restrict a lobby so that only the clan/guild/group leader is allowed to manage the linked channel for the lobby.

method.name: connected
method.description: Returns true if the user is currently connected to the lobby.

method.name: id
method.description: The user id of the lobby member.

method.name: metadata
method.description: Metadata is a set of string key/value pairs that the game developer can use. A common use case may be to store the game's internal user ID for this user so that every member of a lobby knows the discord user ID and the game's internal user ID mapping for each user.

method.name: user
method.description: The [DiscordUserHandle] of the lobby member. Returns [DiscordUserHandle] or [code]null[/code].
